config-rpm.script:
/bin/systemctl -q enable mariadb ps aux | grep -q "[/]sbin/anaconda" || /bin/systemctl start mariadb
# set password - the logic below is to attempt to access the database # *without* a password. If we can, then we know we need to reset the password # and we do so. Otherwise, we assume the password has been correctly set # previously and we do nothing. if mariadb -u root -e "SHOW DATABASES;" &>/dev/null; then mariadb \ -u root \ -e "UPDATE mariadb.user SET Password=PASSWORD('%{mariadb-password}') WHERE User='root'; FLUSH PRIVILEGES;" fi
